intro: Pedicularis rex subsp. rex, commonly known as the royal monkey orchid, is a striking flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its vivid red and yellow flowers, which are often adorned with intricate patterns resembling monkey faces. It thrives in nutrient-poor soils and requires a cool, moist environment to flourish. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and protected species in its native habitat.
